item.description:
(UPDATE ON THURSDAY, MAY 5th)

Hey all, we're a couple of days away from the Mt Monadnock hike! A couple of notes:

 

1. This hike was originally organized by Paula and myself...but Paula can no longer make it. So you're stuck with me! ;)

2. Weather forecast for Friday is as follows for the Monadnock area:

Saturday: A chance of showers. Patchy fog before 7am. Otherwise, partly sunny, with a high near 63. Calm wind becoming west between 4 and 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible

So if the possibility of rain changes your plans, please keep your RSVP updated. Monadnock is exposed at the summit and there are some rocky scrambles that could be treacherous when wet. So if you still plan on coming please take extra care and bring rain gear.

 

Looking forward to this everyone! See you Saturday!

                    John

 

 

We will summit Monadnock, one of the most hiked mountains in the world (Number 2 after Mt Fuji).  Since we do this every year we'll try and mix it up a little bit with a new trail. We'll meet at the Gilson Pond parking area and then carspot over to the park headquarters. We'll summit on the White Cross Trail (2.2 miles, 1800 ft elevation gain) and then descend on the Pumpelly/Red Spot/Birchtoft (3.5 miles) to Gilson Pond. Bring plenty of water, snacks, lunch, and hiking boots! Its windy at the summit, so make sure you bring an extra layer to wear at the top. Plus rain gear if the forecast looks iffy! Pouring rain postpones but drizzle/showers will not. No dogs/children please.

Total Hike 5.7 miles, 1800 ft elevation gain

This is a great Spring warm up hike for experienced hikers, but not a beginner hike. The trail is rocky with some scrambles. We will be moving at a moderate pace.

Its about a 2 hour drive from Providence.

Note that there is a $4 admission fee per person at Monadnock State Park.

 

 

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: We will gather at the Gilson Pond parking area....look for my bright yellow Escape. Cell: 508-414-8544
item.why: Join us for the RI Outdoors annual pilgrimage to the summit of Mt Monadnock! Its a perfect mountain to shake off the winter inactivity and a great warm up for the peaks farther north. There are beautiful views from the top.
item.name: Mt Monadnock 2011
